title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A story about teenage alienation and loss of innocence.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A novel about racial injustice in the Deep South.

author: George Orwell
description: A dystopian novel about totalitarianism and surveillance.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A novel about the American Dream and the Jazz Age.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A classic tale of love and misunderstanding.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: An epic sea story of Captain Ahab's obsession with a white whale.

title: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: A novel that intertwines the lives of families during the Napoleonic Wars.

title: The Odyssey
author: Homer
description: An ancient Greek epic poem about Odysseus' journey home.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: A high-fantasy epic of the quest to destroy the One Ring.

title: The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
author: Mark Twain
description: A novel about the adventures of a boy named Huck on the Mississippi River.

title: Hamlet
author: William Shakespeare
description: A Shakespearean tragedy about revenge, madness, and moral corruption.

title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
author: Gabriel García Márquez
description: A multi-generational story of the Buendía family.

title: The Divine Comedy
author: Dante Alighieri
description: An allegorical tale of Dante's journey through Hell, Purgatory, and Paradise.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A novel about the mental anguish of a man who commits a murder.

title: The Catch-22
author: Joseph Heller
description: A satirical novel about the absurdities of war.
